Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Black pepper crab" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(December 2015)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Black pepper crab** is one of the popular ways that [crab](/wiki/Crab_meat) is served in [Singaporean cuisine](/wiki/Singaporean_cuisine). It is made by frying hard-shell crabs with [black pepper](/wiki/Black_pepper). Unlike the other popular [chilli crab](/wiki/Chilli_crab) dish, it is not cooked in a sauce and therefore has a dry consistency. It is becoming very popular to mix the pepper crab with a fresh [jackfruit](/wiki/Jackfruit) sauce.[*citation needed*] - Food portal - [Chilli crab](/wiki/Chilli_crab) - [Crab in Padang sauce](/wiki/Crab_in_Padang_sauce) - [List of crab dishes](/wiki/List_of_crab_dishes) - [Oyster sauce crab](/wiki/Oyster_sauce_crab) This [meat](/wiki/Meat)-related article is a stub.
